title: HTML
description: This is a beginer html course.

chapters.title: What is HTML?
chapters.content:
- HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language 
 - HTML is the standard markup language for creating Web pages 
 - HTML describes the structure of a Web page 
 - HTML consists of a series of elements 
 - HTML elements tell the browser how to display the content

chapters.title: A Simple HTML Document
chapters.content:
My First Heading

My first paragraph.

chapters.title: Example Explained
chapters.content: -The declaration defines that this document is an HTML5 document - The element is the root element of an HTML page - The element contains meta information about the HTML page - The element specifies a title for the HTML page (which is shown in the browser's title bar or in the page's tab) - The <body> element defines the document's body, and is a container for all the visible contents, such as headings, paragraphs, images, hyperlinks, tables, lists, etc. - The <h1> element defines a large heading - The <p> element defines a paragraph

chapters.title: HTML Documents
chapters.content:
All HTML documents must start with a document type declaration: <!DOCTYPE html>. 
 The HTML document itself begins with <html> and ends with </html>. 
 The visible part of the HTML document is between <body> and </body>.

chapters.title: The <!DOCTYPE> Declaration
chapters.content:
- The <!DOCTYPE> declaration represents the document type, and helps browsers to display web pages correctly. 
 - It must only appear once, at the top of the page (before any HTML tags). 
 - The <!DOCTYPE> declaration is not case sensitive. 
 - The <!DOCTYPE> declaration for HTML5 is: 
 <!DOCTYPE html>

chapters.title: HTML Headings
chapters.content:
- HTML headings are defined with the

to

tags.

defines the most important heading.

defines the least important heading: Example

This is heading 1

This is heading 2

This is heading 3

chapters.title: HTML Attributes
chapters.content: All HTML elements can have attributes Attributes provide additional information about elements Attributes are always specified in the start tag The href Attribute The tag defines a hyperlink. The href attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to: Example: Visit W3Schools The src Attribute The tag is used to embed an image in an HTML page. The src attribute specifies the path to the image to be displayed: Example The width and height Attributes The tag should also contain the width and height attributes, which specify the width and height of the image (in pixels): Example

 - It must only appear once, at the top of the page (before any HTML tags). 
 - The <!DOCTYPE> declaration is not case sensitive. 
 - The <!DOCTYPE> declaration for HTML5 is:
